sen.e: Even though Shiga Prefectural Police requested a stop to the services, Enryaku-ji refused the request, saying that "this is just a religious service", after which a "Special Eitai Eko" was held in Enryaku-ji's Amida-do, a grand ceremony attended by nearly 100 gang members, including top management.

sen.j: なお、同寺を含め全国にある約75,000の寺が所属する財団法人全日本仏教会は、約30年前の1976年、全日本仏教徒会議において「暴力団排除」の決議を行っており、また2006年3月13日には全日本仏教会理事長である安原晃本が「組織暴力団の義理かけ法要への協力を止めよう」との声明を発表した直後であった。
sen.e: Roughly 30 years before that, in 1976, at an All Japan Buddhist Conference, the Japan Buddhist Federation, of which approximately 75,000 temples, including Enryaku-ji, are members, passed a resolution calling for "exclusion of criminal gangs", and on March 13, 2006, chairman of the Federation Ko YASUHARA had made a statement calling for members to "stop cooperating with memorial services for organized criminal gangs" right before the event.
